definition: (of water) to soar/(of prices) to skyrocket

sentences.english: Corn shot up to seventy-three cents a bushel.
sentences.chinese: 谷物猛涨到一蒲式耳七十三美分。

sentences.english: This means a huge increase in the number of rigs supplied by the oil-services firms.
sentences.chinese: 这就意味着，油田服务公司提供的器械数量将猛涨。

sentences.english: Oil prices jumped in the past year.
sentences.chinese: 在过去一年中，石油价格猛涨。

sentences.english: The rush for rice in Hong Kong began after wholesale prices spiked in Thailand.
sentences.chinese: 泰国的大米批发价格猛涨之后，香港人开始抢购大米。

sentences.english: If you’re fighting for prinicples, your costs will likely skyrocket.
sentences.chinese: 如果你正在为案件的原则争论，你的花费将会猛涨。

sentences.english: Jim Avila gets answers about what is behind soaring fuel costs.
sentences.chinese: 近日油价猛涨背后的原因到底是什么。

definition: to clamber up/(of prices etc) to rise
the tide rises, the boat floats (idiom); fig. to change with the overall trend/to develop according to the situation
to surge up/to rise/(of tensions etc) to run high
to advance boldly/to push ahead vigorously
to skyrocket/to get quick promotion in one's career
